```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(here)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(showtext)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyboot)
library(lmerTest)
library(ggpubr)

showtext_auto()

font_add(family = "Lato", regular = here("fonts/Lato-Regular.ttf"))
theme_set(theme_classic(base_size = 15, base_family = "Lato"))
options(contrasts = c(unordered = "contr.sum", ordered = "contr.poly"))

action_colors <- c("#F0E442", "#E69F00", "#D6D6D6")
relationship.colors <- c("#00A08A", "#35ACFF","#B87FFF")
```


# Study 1

```{r}
study_1_data <- read_csv(here("data/study-1_tidy_data.csv")) %>%
  mutate(
    relationship = factor(
      relationship,
      levels = c("no_info", "symmetric", "asymmetric"),
      labels = c("No info", "Symmetric", "Asymmetric")
    ),
    next_interaction = factor(
      next_interaction,
      levels = c("alternating", "repeating", "none"),
      labels = c("Reciprocity", "Precedent", "None")
    )
  )

study_1_summary <- study_1_data %>%
  group_by(relationship, next_interaction) %>%
  tidyboot_mean(likert_rating, na.rm = T)

study_1_summary_scenario <- study_1_data %>%
  group_by(relationship, next_interaction, story) %>%
  tidyboot_mean(likert_rating, na.rm = T)
```


```{r fig.width=6, fig.height=3.5, dpi=125}
ggplot(study_1_data,
       aes(x = relationship, y = likert_rating, fill = next_interaction)) +
  geom_violin(bw = 0.43,
              position = position_dodge(width = 0.7),
              alpha = 0.8) +
  geom_pointrange(
    data = study_1_summary,
    aes(
      x = relationship,
      y = empirical_stat,
      ymin = ci_lower,
      ymax = ci_upper
    ),
    size = 0.3,
    linewidth = 1,
    position = position_dodge(width = 0.7)
  ) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = action_colors) +
  scale_color_manual(values = action_colors) +
  scale_y_continuous(breaks = c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)) +
  labs(title = "Study 1: Equal vs. hierarchical",
       x = "Relationship",
       y = "How likely?",
       fill = "Next interaction") +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom")

ggsave(here("figures/study-1_main.pdf"))
```

# Study 3

```{r}
study_3_data <- read_csv(here("data/study-3_tidy_data.csv")) %>%
  rename(first_actual = first_actual_higher,
         first_response = first_response_higher,
         second_response = second_response_higher) %>%
  mutate(
    first_actual = factor(
      first_actual,
      levels = c("equal", "lower", "higher"),
      labels = c("Equal", "Lower", "Higher")
    ),
    first_response = factor(
      first_response,
      levels = c("equal", "lower", "higher"),
      labels = c("Equal", "Lower", "Higher")
    )
  )

# Implicit coordination
study_3_first_time <-
  study_3_data %>%
  mutate(first_response = recode(first_response, "Higher" = 0, "Lower" = 1)) %>%
  group_by(story, effort_diff, benefit_diff) %>%
  tidyboot_mean(first_response, na.rm = TRUE)


d.temp <- study_3_first_time %>%
  arrange(desc(mean))

levs <- unique(d.temp$story)

study_3_first_time$story <-
  factor(study_3_first_time$story, levels = levs)


# First vs. second time
study_3_second_time <-
  study_3_data %>% filter(symmetric == "asymmetric") %>%
  mutate(second_response = recode(second_response, "higher" = 0, "lower" = 1)) %>%
  group_by(story, first_actual) %>%
  tidyboot_mean(second_response, na.rm = TRUE)

study_3_first_second <-
  left_join(
    study_3_first_time,
    study_3_second_time,
    suffix = c("_first", "_second"),
    by = (c("story"))
  )
```

```{r}
study_2_first_second <- study_2_data %>%
  filter(relationship != "Equal", next_interaction != 'None') %>%
  group_by(subject_id, story, relationship) %>%
  mutate(
    total_rating = sum(likert_rating),
    normalized_likert_rating = likert_rating / total_rating
  ) %>%
  select(-total_rating) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  rename(observed_higher = relationship) %>%
  mutate(
    second_response = case_when(
      next_interaction == 'Precedent' ~ observed_higher,
      next_interaction == 'Reciprocity' ~ ifelse(observed_higher == "Higher", "Lower", "Higher"),
      next_interaction == 'None' ~ 'None'
    )
  )


study_2_first_second_summary <- study_2_first_second %>%
  filter(second_response == 'Lower') %>%
  group_by(story, observed_higher) %>%
  tidyboot_mean(normalized_likert_rating, na.rm = T)


studies_2_3 <-
  left_join(
    study_2_first_second_summary,
    study_3_first_time,
    suffix = c("_2", "_3"),
    by = (c("story"))
  )

```

## Study 3 (concrete relationships) (formerly study 4)

```{r}
study_4_first_second <- study_4_data %>%
  filter(relationship != "Equal", next_interaction != 'None') %>%
  group_by(subject_id, story, relationship) %>%
  mutate(
    total_rating = sum(likert_rating),
    normalized_likert_rating = likert_rating / total_rating
  ) %>%
  select(-total_rating) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  rename(observed_higher = relationship) %>%
  mutate(
    second_response = case_when(
      next_interaction == 'Precedent' ~ observed_higher,
      next_interaction == 'Reciprocity' ~ ifelse(observed_higher == "Higher", "Lower", "Higher"),
      next_interaction == 'None' ~ 'None'
    )
  )


study_4_first_second_summary <- study_4_first_second %>%
  filter(second_response == 'Lower') %>%
  group_by(story, observed_higher, prestige_score, dominance_score) %>%
```

### Regression

```{r}
studies_4_3_all <- studies_4_3_all %>% 
  rename(expected.next.3 = expected.next.4, 
         expected.first.4 = expected.first.3)
```


Same regression as before

```{r}
mod1 <- lmer(
  data = studies_4_3_all,
  expected.next.3 ~ expected.first.4 * observed_higher + (1 |
                                                              subject_id) + (1 | story)
)

summary(mod1)
```
Regression with dominance and prestige score

```{r}
mod2 <- lmer(
  data = studies_4_3_all,
  expected.next.3 ~ (dominance_score + prestige_score + expected.first.4) * observed_higher  + (1 |
                                                              subject_id) + (1 | story)
)

summary(mod2)
```
```{r}
anova(mod1, mod2)
```
plot correlation of dominance score vs. prestige score

```{r}
ggplot(studies_4_3_all, aes(x = prestige_score, y = dominance_score)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "Prestige score", y = "Dominance score") 
```

# Study 5

```{r}
study_5_data <- read_csv(here("data/study-5_tidy_data.csv")) %>%
  mutate(
    participant_rank = case_when(
      partner_status == "equal" ~ "Equal",
      partner_status == "lower" ~ "Higher",
      partner_status == "higher" ~ "Lower"
    ),
    participant_rank = factor(participant_rank, levels = c("Equal", "Lower", "Higher")),
    participant_first_choice = factor(
      participant_first_choice,
      levels = c("receive", "give"),
      labels = c("Receive", "Give")
    ),
    partner_first_choice = factor(
      partner_first_choice,
      levels = c("receive", "give"),
      labels = c("Receive", "Give")
    )
  )

# Analyze first time choices by partner status
study_5_first_time_summary <- study_5_data %>%
  group_by(scenario_id, participant_rank) %>%
```
